quest.name: Vows of Virtue, Deeds of Cruelty
journal: Alphinaud wears a satisfied smile, seemingly content with the state of Eulmore.

Eulmore is in Master Chai's capable hands, the future looks bright, and even the long-suffering Kai-Shirr seems to have found both a place and purpose. Yet there are still problems that remain to be solved, not least those of your fellow Scions. Alphinaud suggests returning to the Crystarium, hopeful that Beq Lugg has made headway in their research.

You arrive to discover that work on the white auracite has not gone as intended. In fact, your comrades have decided to pursue an alternative solution, having realized that their original plans would inevitably have broken the link between mind and soul. While they labor on, Y'shtola suggests you return to the Source and apprise Krile and the others of all that has transpired.

Back at the Rising Stones, Tataru greets your return with customary enthusiasm. Though she is eager to hear of your exploits in the First, she insists you wait for Krile, who is in the process of completing routine ministrations on your stricken comrades. No sooner have you told your tale than you are joined─to your considerable surprise─by the elusive Estinien, who brings troubling tidings from the Empire.

Estinien's account of his journey into imperial territory is interrupted when both you and Krile are overcome by the power of the Echo. In a series of visions from the dragoon's recent past, you bear witness to the murder of Emperor Varis; a grueling battle with Zenos himself; and an encounter with a mechanical monstrosity bearing a striking resemblance to the Ultima Weapon. When you eventually return to your senses, Estinien presses on with his report, concluding at length that the Empire poses no threat for the present, though it remains to be seen where Zenos will next resurface. His contract with Tataru thus fulfilled, your old friend gruffly takes his leave to the disappointment of all present.

Everyone else has resumed their work, leaving you the rare opportunity to enjoy a moment's respite. But can there ever truly be rest for the righteous? The presence of Zenos alone is proof that powerful forces are yet at play, waiting unseen to pounce on any weakness. Until they see fit to reveal themselves, however, you can do naught but steel yourself for what is to come.
objectives: Speak with the Crystal Exarch in the Ocular.
Speak with Tataru at the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Truly, to see Kai-Shirr thus inspired by our actions is inspiring in itself.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet however much I may wish to stay and see what comes of his efforts here in Eulmore, we have matters of our own to attend to. Come, we should return to the Crystal Tower. Mayhap Beq Lugg's studies have borne fruit in our absence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem Alisaie has yet to return from the Inn at Journey's Head. I do hope she doesn't overtire herself...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In the course of preparing more auracite, we made a significant discovery. We thought it best to wait for your return before sharing our findings.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My congratulations, Forename. Glad tidings from Eulmore did precede thy coming. I will see that Thancred and Ryne hear of these momentous events, that they too might take joy in that which thou hast helped to bring about.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I take it you are ready to resume our work?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Welcome back. We are given to understand a new mayor has taken office in Eulmore.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed. Our good friend Master Chai was elected by popular vote, and─after some considerable soul–searching─chose to accept the post.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is a shame you weren't able to attend his inaugural speech. Though I have no doubt you will see more of him in the future.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But tell me, how fared you in preparing the white auracite?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our work...did not proceed quite as expected.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In your absence, we had a frank discussion on the principles of soul transference, and concluded at length that white auracite was ill-suited for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But Urianger─did you not say that, compared to the massy soul of an Ascian, the stone could house one of ours with ease?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That I did. And armed as we are with Beq Lugg's invaluable insight, 'twould indeed prove a trifling matter─were we to disregard the inviolable link 'twixt mind and soul...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...A link which would─we did belatedly realize─be weakened most perilously in the process of rendering our souls dormant, as auracite doth require. Thus, the shedding of these fleshly simulacra, and the surfeit of aether which compriseth them, would in all likelihood deprive us of our psyches as well.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: It would, theoretically, be possible to channel your minds into the auracite instead, but we would more than likely sacrifice your souls in the process.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Which is why we have abandoned that plan, and instead devoted our time to finding a means by which mind and soul might be transported together.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then we are no closer to a solution than when we first began...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: It is a vexing conundrum indeed. But one for which the Crystal Exarch has posited a most intriguing solution.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: When our discussions turned to the transference of memories and the psyche, I could not help but be reminded of a technique with which I have personal experience.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Forename, do you recall what we learned of my eyes from our encounter with Doga and Unei?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I speak of the Royal Eye of the Allagan imperial line, gifted to my forebears through the blood and memories of the ancient Allagans. It is by this gift that I am able to control the Crystal Tower.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: To explain─in the latter days of the Allagan Empire, the last of their kind devised a means to pass on their blood and memories to my forebears. It is through these gifts that I am able to control the Crystal Tower.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: If we were to gain an understanding of the technology by which the Allagans were able to accomplish this transference, perhaps then we could keep mind and soul together.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Imagine, if you will, a device like unto a soul crystal, replete not only with our worldly memories, but also the bountiful energies of the soul.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: That is our current avenue of investigation. And we will follow it wheresoever it leads.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While we are thus engaged, I think it best that Forename return to the Source and inform Krile and the others of our findings.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Agreed. I imagine Tataru will be relieved to hear we've made progress of a sort.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Then I would beg leave to relay our findings unto Thancred and Ryne, and to assist where I may in their investigation of the Empty.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Yes, please do. Should we have need of your counsel we will not hesitate to summon you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Give our regards to Tataru, won't you?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: With the benefit of our combined knowledge, and the aid of the First's leading authority on soulcraft, we must surely be able to find a solution. Surely...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Beq Lugg insists we resume our work forthwith, but I grow weary at the thought... <sigh> What I would not give for a cup of tea, and perhaps a vanilla tart.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I pray the link to their bodies in your world will endure awhile longer. Should it fail, our efforts will be for naught.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Mark my words, Forename─we will unlock the secrets of the Allagan Eye, and see the others returned home.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: There was a time when I thought these eyes a curse, you know... But for what they have enabled me to do, and what they may yet make possible, I see now they are a blessing.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename! You're back!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: How did everything go in the First? Wait─don't tell me. Krile will be here shortly, and she'll want to hear too. She's just tending to the others. Their bodies, I mean. Gods, I don't think I'll ever get used to saying that... Anyway, you can tell us everything the moment she gets here!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon speaking with Tataru, several cutscenes will play in sequence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 80 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Wait for Krile's return?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I've seen him in action. His body at least. You will not best him alone.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Nay...death will not come easily to that thing. If you would join me, then by all means...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: For what good it will do...

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: The Black Wolf...and the Azure Dragoon. I suppose this might suffice.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: Come, then.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: Ah, the simple pleasure of one's own flesh. Truly, there is no place like home.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Abomination...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Whatever he is, Forename was barely a match for him. If we stay here much longer─

dialogue.name: ANNIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Emperor Varis! Your Radiance, are you all right!?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...We may wear out our welcome.

dialogue.name: JULIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text: Your Radiance... No!

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: <sigh> Must even the most middling of sport be spoiled? The world conspires to bore me.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: But I have no cause to remain. I leave these vermin to you.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Zenos!!!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Well? Any bright ideas?

dialogue.name: ANNIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for? Open fire!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Just one.

dialogue.name: JULIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text: Gaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: ANNIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text: Your Radiance...

dialogue.name: JULIAQUOSORANUS
dialogue.text:
The intruders have taken flight. I repeat, the intruders have taken flight.
Deploy all available magitek armor. We cannot let them escape!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Well, well... Someone's been busy.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: And you would bar my way, would you? ...So be it.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Come, Nidhogg! Lend me your strength!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text:
Garleans and their machina...
Now...where are you, Gaius?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Though they have yet to find a workable solution, Y'shtola and the others are making progress, and we cannot ask for more than that.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You must be shattered after all that hopping back and forth between worlds. Why not stay here and rest for a while? I'm sure Beq Lugg can manage without you. They've got enough Scions to help them, if you ask me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in Garlemald...

dialogue.name: THIRDLEGIONCENTURION
dialogue.text: Traitors! You would dare deny Lord Nerva the throne!?

dialogue.name: THIRDLEGIONCENTURION
dialogue.text: Aaah!

dialogue.name: FIRSTLEGIONCENTURION
dialogue.text: Onward! Before this day is done, victory shall be ours!

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: Boring, boring, boring...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSCOOPERATOR
dialogue.text: (-???-)Do you think? I find it amusing. Like dogs herding cattle to the slaughterhouse.

dialogue.name: ZENOS
dialogue.text: That hue. Your soul is... Who are you?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSCOOPERATOR
dialogue.text: Before your majesty, I am but another dog. Lost, in want of a new master. A hunting dog if you should wish it so.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSCOOPERATOR
dialogue.text: For I know full well the prey you would seek next.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSCOOPERATOR
dialogue.text: ...Zodiark.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in Eulmore in the First...

dialogue.name: DIRTYMAN
dialogue.text: Did you hear? The mayor's reopening Daedalus Stoneworks, and they're looking for laborers!

dialogue.name: SHABBYWOMAN
dialogue.text: There's talk of resettling some of the old, abandoned villages too. They're even laying on free Talos to help anyone willing to make the move.

dialogue.name: DIRTYMAN
dialogue.text: Free Talos? Hah! We'd best get packing.

dialogue.name: SHABBYWOMAN
dialogue.text: Steady work, board and lodging... If that's not a recipe for hope, I don't know what is.

dialogue.name: PALEFACEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Warrior-)Yes. So long as I yet live, I would see that feeble flame rekindled.

dialogue.name: PALEFACEMAN
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Warrior-)It is my destiny. To see our dream fulfilled.
